titles.title: A bill to provide for a nationwide milk marketing order with multiple basing points, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Livestock, Dairy, and Poultry.
Referred to Subcommittee on Domestic Marketing, Consumer Relations, and Nutrition.
Unfavorable Executive Comment Received From USDA.

committee.subcommittee: Domestic Marketing, Consumer Relations, and Nutrition
committee.name: House Agriculture

bill.summary: 1/22/1987--Introduced. Amends the Agricultural Adjustment Act, as reenacted with amendments by the Agricultural Marketing Agreement Act of 1937, to provide for a nationwide milk marketing order. States that for related price adjustments at delivery locations, there shall be at least three but not more than six U.S.-located basing points.
